name: 林郁修　Office Hours
objective: This semester's Artificial Intelligence (AI) course will focus on Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) in data science analytics. We will look at supervised and unsupervised learning methods, which will include classic Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP), Deep Neural Networks/Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), and k-Means clustering. This course is designed for graduate students who are interested in AI and its applications in data science analytics. Students who take this course should have mathematical maturity of undergraduate curricula in science and engineering, including Calculus, Discrete Mathematics, Linear Algebra and programming language such as C/C++/MATLAB/Python. Teaching approaches conducted in this course emphasize analysis, modeling and design principles of AI methodology. Case studies, engineering applications of AI in data science analytics, will also be covered in this course. Collaboration Policy: You are free to form study groups and discuss programming assignments and projects. However, you must write up assignments and code independently, and you must acknowledge in your submission all the students you discussed with.
